title: Has a major Input / BIOS issue, support didn't help
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 10, 2018
text: The actual quality of the monitor is good, but the monitor itself has some issues with certain motherboards and/or GPUs. The monitor refuses to show the BIOS menu. (The menu actually loads but the monitor will display "input not supported" for the entire time, making it useless if you have to change one of those settings), but it works perfectly once the operating system reaches the login screen.  I had to plug my computer into my TV to view the bios screen, and that worked, so I know that it's a monitor issue. Called up ACER support, said there was nothing they could do.

title: Works great for a minute
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020
text: Just needed a 2nd monitor.  Was pleased to get this back in March.  It was exactly what I needed.  A simple monitor that was light weight and only served as 2nd monitor.  Nothing fancy.  And that's exactly the purpose it served.  Until the end of June.  And now it's just done.  It just doesn't work any more.  It won't register the HDMI cable anymore.  I thought ok, maybe the cable went bad.  Went out and bought a new one, and it's not reading the new one either.  It's clearly turning on, so it's not the power cord.  The monitor is just refusing to register the HDMI cable.  It's just done now.  So, it was fine for the first 3 months.  It's just done now.  I guess I got my, what, $13/mo technology out this.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: Poor interface, outdated manual and DOES NOT TILT
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 6, 2019
text: Nice enough screen and a good price, but ‚Ä¶* Contrary to several reader reviews and comments here, Acer confirms for me that the screen doesn't tilt, even a little. Unfortunate, since I bought this on the assumption it would. NOTE: The detailed manual for this screen (which does not ship with the screen; you have to download it from the Amazon or Acer websites) says it DOES tilt, but that manual (which is dated 2016) clearly doesn't reflect the product shipping in 2019.* Contrary to some posts here (and to the manual, which says they are "optional"‚Äînot "available separately," which would be clearer), the screen does not ship with an HDMI or audio cable.* The menu options for this are bewilderingly complex (download the manual) and not easy to navigate with the under-screen controls.Buyer beware. I returned mine to Amazon.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: A monitor that can't detect whether it's connected by an HDMI cable.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 15, 2021
text: If you want a monitor that can't detect whether it's connected by an HDMI cable, this piece of garbage is the one for you. To be more accurate, sometime it will and sometimes it won't. If it doesn't work you set the connection to HDMI and turn off auto-detect, it still won't work. You can fiddle with it for an hour and still no picture. But sometimes, for no apparent reason, it will pick up the signal.So if you want to spend a lot of time trying to get the signal to display, this is is good choice.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: too basic
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020
text: Con: No USB to provide power to Fire TV stick or Raspberry Pi; Has HDMI in but no audio (confusingly manual does show a volume control but that's for some other unspecified model); blacks are not very black; apparently it does have tilt, but I pressed as hard as I felt comfortable doing before risking breakage and could not make it tilt. No height adjustment.  Comes with only VGA cable - if only supplying one cable, HDMI would have been a more sensible default.  If it wasn't the cheapest display on the market on Black Friday I'd have sent it back, but I need a really cheap display so I'll live with the limitations. Pro: good resolution and sharp picture, good price.

title: If it worked it would be a Great Monitor. DO NOT BUY
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 4, 2020
text: Picture quality is great, size is good for what I need. The monitor is exactly what I am looking for. But it does not work. It worked great for a couple of day out of the box then when using it the monitor just turned off and shows no signs of life. I tried unplugging plugging back in, pressing the power switch, checking video connections. nothing. So had a replacement sent thinking mine was just a dud. Replacement monitor works great. For one day. Second day it does the same thing as the first. After reading reviews this really seems to be a problem with this product. How it has nearly 80% 5 stars is beyond me. But I would strongly urge you to buy a different product.

text: I ended up returning this monitor because of the issues I had with playing videos and there being significant ghosting with the video afterimage. This caused some strange flashing colors as if it was cycling through colors to switch them, but I could see it switch them. I don't know much about monitor construction, but I do know that when using Netflix to watch Parks and Recreation, the color ghosting was so distracting that I could not keep this monitor. Perhaps with just typing or web browsing it could be tolerable, but I had to send it back.

title: Terrible Acer Customer Support
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020
text: As a lot of the other reviews mentioned...this is a 90 dollar monitor; you shouldn't expect a whole lot from the monitor. That said it looks fine, it works fine, and I was happy...for a month.I bought this monitor to use while working from home due to Covid-19. I got one month in and a green line of unresponsive pixels shows up. Talking to customer service my only option...send it in and they will repair it in 7 - 10 days after they receive it. So not only do I need to go out into public, which the CDC and local government advise against, but I have to be without a second monitor for up to 2 weeks... So much for working productively from home.Thanks Acer, I will buy from anyone else from now on.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: Complete Garbage--Don't Waste Your Money!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 17, 2019
text: This monitor is complete garbage. It worked for all of about a month. Then the problems began. The monitor would "blank" out, a black screen replacing it. At first, I thought it was the VGA cable. So, I purchased a new one. That didn't fix the problem. So, I replaced the dongle (the next "cheap" thing to replace). It came back on, but only to have the screen go green. Upset that the color was completely off, I fiddled with the cables a bit, hopeful that the color would come back. Instead, the screen went black once more... and so it has remained regardless of which new wires I try to replace (VGA and HDMI), dongles, etc. Nothing brings this piece of garbage monitor back online.Don't waste your money, folks. This one is definitely a dud.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: Issues after 6 months and the warranty is poor
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 20, 2020
text: After 6 months I started having issues with the monitor. Since the monitor was still under warranty I contacted Acer and expected them to send a replacement and I would ship back the broken monitor. I chatted with a customer rep and sent them pictures of the issue so they could clearly see what was wrong. Instead of sending a new monitor right away, I have to ship the broken monitor to them (at my expense!) then wait 15-20 business days to either get a new monitor or a they repair my broken monitor. Don't buy this monitor expecting Acer to make it easy to repair/replace this under the warranty. It will cost you time and money. Buy any other brand.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 2, 2020
text: While this seems to be a successful product for many, it has been a disaster for me. This monitor did work fine, as many reviews have stated, for a couple weeks. After that, it would shut down on me a minimum of three times a day causing me to lose any documents that I had not had the opportunity to save. We brought in IT and determined that the computer was fine, it was indeed the monitor that was having the issue. I realize it is a cheaper monitor but either way I expect it to perform as the product description promises. It is not worth the gamble of whether this monitor will work for you or not.

I got a new HDMI cable but no luck, I tweaked around with my laptop and it turns out only my monitor froze and not my laptop. The game was running totally fine on the laptop.The problem is really annoying and i think im going to be returning this very soon.But over all the picture quality is great and I like the overall slim design.Should you buy it?Price is great but the quality no so much.I would not risk buying this as it seems to be a common issue with this monitor and acer‚Äôs other monitors.

text: The monitor was beautiful at first, but the problems quickly arose within 24 hours of minimal use. A common theme among the 1-star reviews is the monitor "blacking out"; that is in fact true. My monitor began to go black randomly without reason and then the resolution also become distorted to the point of looking like playing an Atari video game from 1983. I used two different HDMI cords on a brand new HP laptop.The physical design of the monitor is sleek and attractive; unfortunately that concludes any positives. I was tempted to replace, but after reading that many other users experienced the same issue, I have opted for a return and will search for a different brand.

title: Extremely low-quality picture...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2019
text: While this monitor boasts some impressive features on paper such as a 75hz refresh rate and AMD FreeSync support, don't be fooled. This monitor costs $90 and you will never, ever forget that while using it. Down to the extremely poor build quality - flimsy stand, very light components - to the picture quality with its washed out colors, terrible viewing angles, lacking contrast, and in my experience, unbelievably high levels of ghosting present with moving images, this monitor will never fail to let you down. The only way this monitor could be worse is if it didn't even turn on.

My 30 days to return has passed (issue only started after 30 days of ownership :(. Disappointed. A different purchase (NOT ACER!) is in order.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: Decent display and so thin you wont have to worry about it taking up space
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 1, 2018
text: My son and I are building a gaming computer.  We are collecting the parts slowly but surely.  I am not a computer nor gaming expert, but I have a general understanding of technology and whatnot.  I guess I would say I know what's good and not good.  We don't have the brains of the computer yet, so this review will be about the monitor alone.  I hooked up a Roku box to get an idea of the display.  I went to gaming channels on YouTube to see how they would look once we got this all together.First off, I am amazed at how thin this screen is.  On top of that it's feather-light.  Easy to assemble the stand.  It only has one HDMI port and one VGA port.  Is this enough for a good gaming computer monitor?  I'm sure I will find out later.  It would be bad for a TV, that I know.  The display is clear and bright.  Now understand I am looking at the display vs. a TV.  That's all I really know.  I'd give a sharpness victory to a decent HDTV.  This monitor's display looks good, but I feel it could be better.  Once I got the gaming video up on the screen, I felt the monitor did complement the game more.  This could also be indicative of the Roku box I was using as well.Speaking of which, the monitor has specific pre-sets just for game, such as "racing", "action,", and "movie".  This I liked.  I need my monitor settings as simple as possible.  I don't want to have to fiddle around with warmth, sharpness, and things of that like.  Overall I like it.  I know it's not top of the line, but my son can deal with that when he gets a job and wants to create his ultimate dream system.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: It ain't working right.  FIXED!!!!  See update below.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2019
text: First I want to say I gave it one star for gaming because I have NO IDEA how it is for gaming.  Had I been able to skip that rating, I would have.  Color seems fine, screen quality seems fine.  However, my desktop comes up with 1-1/2 blue lines on the left and right hand sides.  A thin blue line at the top of my desktop picture.  And some kind of "ghost" just above the system tray gizmo that's always at the bottom of the screen.  I called Acer tech support and got a very nice gentleman who could barely speak English.  His final conclusion was that the monitor if faulty and now I have to ship it back for repair or replacement.  The good news is I will be reimbursed for shipment and won't have to pay a dime to fulfill this annoying operation.  I read so many good reviews about this model, I didn't hesitate to buy it.  Right now I'm frustrated to the max.  I'm no techie and have no techies near me who could help me out, so I have to go with what the Acer rep said.  This monitor if very close to the one that died on me, and yet, after pulling up a program on hulu, I see I have 1-1/2" black bars on either side of the screen.When this finally gets resolved, I will update--if I can figure out how to do that.  LOL.UPDATE 4-15-19:  I was pretty sure the problem was some setting in the monitor.  I emailed a brilliant techie friend of mine about the problem, including sending him screen shots of what the desktop looked like and what the setting for resolution said.  He said there was nothing wrong with the monitor. [Oddly enough, the screen resolution was set to properly.]  He took over my computer remotely, went into various settings--I have no idea what he actually changed.  He was moving the cursor around so fast, clicking on this, that and the other thing, that I couldn't follow the procedure.  After maybe 10 or 15 minutes, the monitor was working perfectly.  So much for Acer tech support.  I've upgraded the rating to 5 stars because now that it's working properly, I love this monitor.  Colors are bold, Iris Mini works well to block out "blue light" without distorting colors, text is in focus and as sharp as I'm used to seeing it.  All in all, I'd recommend this monitor.  I didn't see a review here mentioning the same problem I had, but I'd still give my recommendation with the caveat to have a techie friend available who can easily fix the same problem I had should you run into it.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: Beautiful Feature-Packed Monitor
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2018
text: For the price this is a great monitor IF you want it for gaming and IF you are OK gaming at 1080p.IMPORTANT: Since this is an AMD Freesync monitor, you should really only buy this if you have a Freesync compatible graphics card (otherwise you're paying extra for functionality you won't use).  That said, if you have one this should sync up with no issue (my RX 480 immediately recognized it as compatible).A nice bonus is that this monitor has a 75Hz refresh rate instead of the standard 60, which results in smoother gameplay if your card is capable of 75 FPS at 1080p.  The 4 ms refresh rate is nice (but also expected at this price point).  While this not being 120Hz is a bit of disappointment (120 Hz at 1080p is a current sweet spot for gaming machines), at this price its understandable, especially given the inclusion of Freesync.The monitor itself is very striking, with almost no bezels and a thin profile.  I personally love the look (there is even a fun textured circle pattern on the base), but its important to note if you use an monitor mounted webcam or similar.  Since there are practically no bezels that sort of solution won't work as well on this monitor.The monitor itself is an IPS monitor, which means great viewing angles and good color accuracy.  With my Spyder5Pro I measured 97% RGB, 70% NTSC, and 75% AdobeRGB.  These are good values for gaming and everyday use, but not sufficient for professional photography, videography, or similar.  The monitor also shipped with washed out colors - calibration made a noticeable improvement to the display.Overall I'm very, very happy with this monitor.  It includes all the right features at the right price, with nothing extra (i.e. no speakers, which is a plus here in my mind as it cuts down on the price and keeps the display thinner).  Beyond that, its stylish, fairly lightweight, and a breeze to setup with Freesync.My only complaint so far is the color accuracy out of the box - its still very pretty, but there being such a noticeable improvement from calibration is a bit disappointing ... I would have liked it better calibrated out of the box, without the need for professional calibration tools.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: This thing is awesome!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2019
text: We've came such a long way with monitors. I recieved this one from my parents for the holidays (I had it on my holiday list). Picture is quite good and clear and viewing angles are much better than the TN display on my last monitor and on my laptop. The monitor does rotate back about 15 degrees but the mechanism is very stiff which worries me (try placing your hands on the sides on the thicker portion).The bezels are very small on 3 sides, probably around a centimeter. The software for tuning the image is a tad laborious since all the buttons are on the rear of the monior unfortunately. I/O wise the monitor has a small laptop sized power plug, 1 HDMI port and 1 VGA port. The lack of USB or a second HDMI port is dissappointing, but it appears to be standard in this class.Honestly my biggest complaint is the glossy plastic finish on the stand. I HATE this finish if its not just an accent since it collects fingerprints, dust and scratches just by breathing on it. My Xbox One has a similar finish and it looks like I attempted to balance a live kitten on it (there are heavy scratches even under the rubber feat my hard drive sits on). Having a matte plastic base and stand would make this product much better.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: Great monitor with few drawbacks.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2019
text: Very impressed with the quality of this screen and the colors are just fine if not bright. The screen has a flat texture which is excellent for any glare or lighting issues. With that being said my biggest upset is with the stand and mount options for this monitor. It sucks.. and big time.. for 1 the stand is integrated so much into this monitor that it can NOT be removed without damaging the screen. What do I mean? So my problem in particular is my monitor leans down on the left side (about half inch drop) which can be quite annoying at times esp for gaming. So my thought was to try and slightly bend said plastic stand to help correct the fault, then my screen flickered..in a very bad way, as if this bracket itself was pushing on the screen panel from behind.. huge problem.. and no vesa mount either.. which is also a con for me needing my monitor to be wall mounted. But I knew this going in. Budget and time. I needed a monitor and this did the trick but will not be a monitor I will keep or reorder in the future. Considering 7inch to 77 inch screens almost always have mounting options. Just silly for a current product to be lacking in something so easily fixed.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: A beautiful, crisp, sharp display, a nice basic monitor.  No built in speakers.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2018
text: I like this monitor a lot.  It's noticeably bigger than my old monitor, with a nice wide screen.  The colors are very sharp---I am noticing details that I never saw before in pictures I've seen lots of times!  Setting it up was quite easy.  It did not come with an HDMI cord (it did come with a VGA cord), so we had to use our own, but that wasn't a big problem.  My husband had thought that most all HD monitors that worked with HDMI cords had built-in speakers.  So at first we couldn't figure out why we couldn't get sound, but finally we realized this just doesn't come with sound!  Not a problem, my old speakers are fine, but it's an example I guess that this is quite a basic model, although it delivers what I want in a monitor---a beautiful screen with nice graphics, at a price that seems quite reasonable to me (I got this to test, but I'd buy it at the price listed for sure)  So I'm happy!

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: Perfect for gaming, movies, and general use. Recommended!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2018
text: There's so much to love about this monitor! Here are the reasons it won me over:*Super thin*Wide viewing angle*Excellent image quality for movies, gaming, and general use*Reasonable price pointThe only thing that would've made it better is the ability to mount it on the LCD arm I have on my standing desk. When I unboxed this, I was kind of taken aback that it didn't have mounting holes built in.That frustration aside, this is an excellent monitor at a more than fair price.Recommended. 4 stars.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: Amazing color accuracy great for media consumption and good 4ms response time for console gaming.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2020
text: Great for all around use watching movies looks amazing and gaming is good the 75hz cannot be used for console but thats only because consoles run at native 60hz. Most important thing is the color accuracy on this monitor the 1080p ips panel for the price is top tier, one of the best budget monitors on the market. Only flaw I can point out is the factory picture settings which set the overdrive mode to 'Normal' I found the monitor looks best with this set to 'Off' other than that everything works great not a single problem after 1 year of continuous use.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi

text: I currently use this as my primary monitor on my home desk, with my Mac laptop screen and another full monitor as two additional screens. The monitor installed itself, detecting necessary settings based on my computer, and has been working well for many years now with no deterioration in the picture or screen quality. Overall, this monitor has been a great addition to my home office.

title: Good Monitor

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: Seeing Is Believing
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 14, 2018
text: Yes, after you witness this monitor bringing your favorite pictures/games/movies to life.... you will be a true believer - in not just Acer, but in it's full HD widescreen 4ms FREESYNC IPS ultra thin zero frame awesomeness.The games I like to play are graphic intensive, Arma 3 for example....  and the PC I use is a dedicated gaming machine, so I was well equipped to give this monitor a good "run for it's money" ‚Ä¶Verdict - Holy Moley! (translated = fast flaw free, beautiful 3D like graphics that provide a truly immersive gaming experience... HDMI & VGA which is good....however, a 2.1 display port would have been a worthy addition as well.For the money.... this is a steal! seriously..... how do they make any $$ ??IMO Acer has great high quality products,  I have been using Acer monitors for many years & have never had a problem with any of them.... not a single one, so I can recommend Acer with confidence based on years of real life experience.If you are looking for an excellent 21.5 in. gaming monitor at a super price.... look no further, you have found it!!5 stars - highly recommended

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: If you're looking for a 22 inch monitor, this is a good choice
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 31, 2018
text: This is a really great monitor at this size. The colors produced are vivid and clear. It's also not straining to the eye. I've got an older acer where the colors were a bit harsh. The monitor has been great for watching movies and web browsing. But the maximum resolution is 1080p and gamers may want a bit more. The AMD FreeSync technology does seem to smooth at any cinematic scenes both in movies and games. I also don't notice any unevenness in the light output. The monitor is also very stylish with a near bezel-less design in the front and freakishly thin from the sides.Pros:- Ultra thin and ultra light- 1080p resolution and produces vivid colors for videos- HDMI and VGA port (HDMI should be used)- Near bezel-less designCons:- 1080p resolution, gamers might prefer higher resolution- 21.5 inches, if you're not limited in space, then 24 inch monitor is what i'd be looking for

title: Great monitor, and it tilts!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2018
text: I was looking for a cheap display that would be lightweight and portable for software demonstrations and training. Although there are a few contenders for the sub-$100 21.5" category, I saw a few features that made this monitor somewhat more appealing that lead me to decide on this model.PROS:4ms refresh rate! Other competitors boast 5-8ms for the same priceVivid & bright display, excellent photo-like color reproductionUp to 75Hz refresh rate, AMD FreeSyncLightweight, very portableMany options available in the OSDAND IT TILTS! Tilt is limited to about 15 degrees back but it does tilt!CONS:Stand does not adjust vertically and is somewhat lowNo VESA mount or dual monitor mount options available (to date)No HDMI cable in the box, only a VGA cable. (Acer, whyyy?)Overall, I am very happy with this purchase. Not only does it meet my needs but I am incredibly impressed with the look, quality, and features this monitor has to offer. It's a simple monitor, but simple isn't necessarily a bad thing if that's all that you need!

text: Bought two to replace my failing monitors. Picture's quite crisp and clear, and the menus are easy enough to navigate to get the settings just right. For an inexpensive monitor, you could do a lot, lot worse.

text: I use the older model of this same screen and I've had them for a least 2 years now. They still work perfectly with no dead pixels. I have to look at them for 8-10 hours a day and they never hurt my eyes. The bezels are of course super skinny which is great. My only is issue is that in direct sunlight they are kind of hard to see. But most of the time that isn't an issue. The newer model may have already fixed this slight issue. Great value overall, you can't go wrong!

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: Basic no frills monitor with good picture.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2018
text: This is a basic no-frills monitor. It does not have any height adjustment but after a bit of force, there seems to be a small tilt adjustment. It doesn't even come with instructions on how to assemble it. It comes with a VGA cable but no HDMI cable. It claims to be no frame but that only means the glass covers the bezel. There is still a frame around the viewable area. The picture quality is nice especially if you like IPS panels.Despite the lack of instructions, assembly is easy. The center piece goes into the base and under the base is a thumbscrew that joins those pieces. Then the panel locks into the top of that by two tabs. There are several buttons underneath that have no label. The power button is the one closest to the blue LED.Overall, this is a decent no-frills monitor that someone on a budget should be perfectly happy with.***= "It's OK"

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: NO VESA mount, so no flexibility
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2018
text: This is a decent, journeyman level monitor that has a great picture, works with most of the computers you would be likely to connect (in my case this is Mac laptops and Windows 10 PC) and has only one real defect. That is that that it cannot take a VESA mount so it just sits on the desk on its little stand. The stand it comes with only allows a bit of tilt, so in order to raise and lower the height you must put it on a stack or risers (the right way) or do like a lot of folks and put it on top of small Amazon boxes or something similar. Some of you may work in a place that still has physical books you could use for this as well ...The reason, I think, that this otherwise nice monitor cannot take a VESA (four hole mount about 4‚Äù across) in the back, is that it was apparently designed to look as super thin as possible at the modest price point. As a result, there is not really enough monitor body to put screw holes into. This is one of those things that happens when someone designs something and then doesn‚Äôt have to actually use it when the prototypes come out (or ever). Looks neat with the thin bezel and very thin side profile, but since I actually look at the screeen of my monitor, use multiple monitors in my work area, and need to be able to adjust height, angle, placement, twist it around for visitors to see during meetings, etc. I need to have that VESA mount or a much more articulated stand like the old DELL monitors had. I could do with a bit less style and this one super functional feature.So, a five star (for the price) monitor made into a 3 star monitor for single screen users who need no mounting flexibility. Sad.

text: So, first of all the monitor has a great picture. I really like the color and picture quality. The response time is great also and when using "freesync" with my Radeon RX 580 GPU it really looks great. It would be a much better product if there were included speakers, but it's well worth the price even without the speakers. The only issue I have is the monitor seems to not be able to register any input while my PC is booting up. If I try to access the BIOS menu on my PC, I'm unable to see anything at all. In fact, the monitor doesn't show any picture until windows had completely booted up. This isn't a deal breaker, since I can use a different monitor if I need to access the BIOS on my PC...but I really wish this wasn't an issue to begin with.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: My monitor doesn't work & Acer has been the worst customer service experience of my life..
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 25, 2021
text: Three separate times I have had to return my monitor to Acer for repairs and yet I still don't have the problem solved--we're going on multiple months of the same issue. All three times have been the same issue: the monitor is on, but won't display anything despite trying numerous devices and cables. The first two times, they "repaired" the monitor. Both times, it worked for a few weeks, then developed the same problem.Note, each time I shipped, packing was at my own expense. So I've racked up over $60 in packing expenses not to mention the time and inconvenience of traveling back and forth from FedEx. Let's also add that each interaction with their service agents took far too much of my time and an extraordinary amount of effort to get them to move even a finger.This time, they offered to "replace" the monitor. My monitor was delivered back to their facility per my FedEx tracking number, yet I have been unable to get a hold of anyone that can do anything about my issue. I simply get put into Chat Box Hell with a "lvl 1" agent who informs me that they can't do anything about my problem and I should try again later.I've sunk way too much of my life into dealing with these people and I've given up.  At this point, I'm convinced they're going to keep my money and never give me a working monitor. I will never buy an Acer product again and I will always associate their company name with the absolutely horrendous customer service and product quality I've received at every time of this miserable experience.

title: Not recommended.

text: I bought this product from staples, but figured most people will buy it from Amazon so I'll make a review here.The viewing angles are the worst I've seen in any monitor. My main monitor has a tn panel, so I assumed it wouldn't be that bad. This is horrible. The increase in refresh rate and freesync are good, however. One this that really does get me though, this monitor was released in 2018. The one I got was manufactured in late 2020. How does a monitor this new not come with a vesa mount. Like, seriously, I have to spend extra money to get regular functionality out of a monitor I just purchased. I am unbelievably underwhelmed with this monitor. Just spend the extra 30 dollars and get a better one.

title: So good I bought it twice!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2022
text: For an everyday PC user, this is a wonderful monitor! I bought this for the first time in 2019 for my son and that one is still working, in pristine condition with a great picture and quality. I was so happy to see that it was still available when it was time for me to purchase a 2nd monitor, and for an even lower price! I'm not a gamer, but I am an avid content creator, and life coach and am always on my computer. Having the 2nd monitor is a lifesaver. Especially if you do live streaming and need 2 screens.  If you are looking for a great monitor, at an even better price point, don't pass this one up! You will not be disappointed.Please Note: If you are an avid gamer, this is not the monitor you want unless you need something to get by until you can get one with a higher Hertz & refresh rate. But it would be a great starter one if you are working with a budget. That's the only reason I gave a 4-star rating for the gaming category. It's not a 1440p monitor, but it will do the trick if you are on a budget.

title: Picture quality is good for the price, quality is good, and it‚Äôs pretty bright
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2021
text: I brought this monitor for online classes and work. The screen is good for the price and it is surprisingly thin. You can use it for 12+ hours and it is barely warm. Works and gets along great with my MacBook Pro however it doesn‚Äôt include an HDMI cable so you‚Äôll have to use your own. There is a VGA port and HDMI port along with the power supply at the back. Its great for gaming even if your a competitive player looking for a cheap monitor. One drawback is the fact that even though it says ‚Äúthin bezels‚Äù the bezels are still a good half inch thick. Another drawback is the fact that the monitor arrived preprogrammed at 60 percent brightness and in blue light shield mode, making the picture appear yellow. The monitor also does not have any built in speakers. So far it has been worked flawlessly and the instructions are relatively easy to read. Overall, I‚Äôm satisfied with this monitor and will consider buying another.

text: I have used this monitor as:1) extra screen for work2) to show movies3) to play games (sims only)The monitor works great! No audio, but decently sized and overall great monitor. Your standard decent monitor.Some reviews mentioned that you cannot tilt it - you can. The screw is a bit tight, but you can definitely tilt it back and forth. Because the screw is a bit tighter then you would expect, I would honestly tilt the gear before attaching the monitor (that way you don't mess up the screen while trying to tilt). Super lightweight and thin too - which is great if you plan on moving it around and setting it up in different locations.10/10 would recommend - especially at this price.

text: Like many folks in similar situations, I was in immediate need of a monitor to telework from home while on quarantine. This monitor is everything that I needed and I am both satisfied and relieved. I use this monitor with a Macbook Pro 15" alongside another external USB monitor; all plays nice together. The monitor came with a VGA cord that is just long enough to use on a desk. Luckily, I had a toggle that is USB-C and had VGA, display port, etc on it. The VGA plugged right into that and I was able to use the monitor immediately and without changing any settings on the display itself. No software to install or drivers. Very happy about that! Great product!

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: Very nice and light weight.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2021
text: Having spent the last month working on 21.5" i-macs (2009,2010,2012,2015) which weight over 23 pounds each I was very happy to receive this monitor to use as a second monitor for my 2010 MacBook pro 13".  The monitor is very lightweight, just 5 pounds .5 ounces (without cables) and not massive looking on my desk.Since my old 2010 MacBook pro does not have HDMI I am using a display port to HDMI converter cable.  Using this cable to hook up to an HDMI cable I am able to use the monitor at 1280x720 and 60.00 Hz VSync.  My old computer (with the converter cable) is unable to display 1920x1080 without some artifacts, but it does work.  This is no fault of the monitor.  Other than that issue with my old computer I am having no technical issues with the monitor.  Very happy with my purchase.Looking forward to seeing how this monitor displays with my upcoming AMD Ryzen build...Highly recommended, lightweight, and a great price.EDIT:  Enabled the NVidia graphics card on the 2010 MacBook pro running Linux 20.1 Cinnamon and now the monitor is displaying 1920x1080 flawlessly.  :-)

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: Delivery Instruction Was Not Followed
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 7, 2021
text: This review is how it was delivered.  The Amazon delivery person did not follow my instruction as to where I want the packaged to be dropped off.  Front door.  Not by the gate, where the package was dropped off.  I prefer to have my pkgs dropped off by the front door.  This did not happen.  My monitor was dropped off by the gate in plain sight to anyone who could be walking by the house and clearly see the box labeled "monitor".  Luckily for me, my Echo dot, along with the app on my phone, notified me that my pkg has been delivered.  So I'm giving the delivery person 1 star.As for the monitor itself, 5 stars.  This is my 2nd purchased.  This one is actually for my father.  A late Christmas present.  I didn't know what to get him for Christmas till a couple days before.  My dad is happy with his gift.  This monitor is great.  There are no bells and whistle.  It's a flat screen, about 21.5 in, HD..what more do you want?  It's AFFORDABLE TOO!  So yeah, I love this monitor.  Thanks Acer!

text: This monitor has served very well. The picture quality is just right for me to enjoy playing my games at the highest quality. The brightness is just right and hasn‚Äôt been a problem when others want to try and see my screen from other angles. The only thing that would make this perfect is a built-in speaker. The packaging was done with care and the packaging provides thorough instructions in order to get this setup as quickly as possible. Instructions really aren‚Äôt needed for this either, it‚Äôs a very straightforward and easy process. This monitor will do you good for a long time while maintaining a reasonable price tag.

product_name: Acer 21.5 Inch Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Ultra-Thin Zero Frame Computer Monitor (HDMI & VGA Port), SB220Q bi
title: Perfect
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 6, 2021
text: Perfect. The setup is super simple just push in three parts into each other and its ready to go. The monitor comes with a VGA cable instead of hdmi though which my computer doesn't support but that wasn't a problem for me since I already had an extra hdmi cable for my tv which I just used instead. The monitor definitely tilts fowards and back and I don't feel like it's going to break either. The monitor is sturdy and it's just perfect.
